clinical_study.brief_title: A Multicenter Study of Clinical Epidemiology of Breast Cancer in Shaanxi Province of China
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Study of Clinical Epidemiology of Breast Cancer in Shaanxi Province of China (Based on Hospital)

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to study the epidemic features and diagnosis of female breast cancer, especially the diagnosis and treatment of breast cancer.The disease-free survival (DFS) and the total survival time(OS) of the breast cancer patients will also be studied.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is a multicentric, retrospective clinical study based on the hospital. The target number of cases are X patients who are eligible for breast cancer after radical mastectomy. To collect the clinicopathological data and treatment data of the breast cancer patients and do the follow-up visit of all the patients who are included in the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall five-year survival for the female breast cancer patients

arm_group.description: Observe the features of clinical diagnosis and treatment for female breast cancer patients

intervention.intervention_name: The radical mastectomy of breast cancer
intervention.description: The radical mastectomy of breast cancer could be used for the treatment of breast cancer during the observation.

study_pop.textblock: The female breast cancer patients in Shaanxi Province of China, those study population shoud be the hospitalized patients who are confirmed of the primary breast cancer histologically, moreover, the date of the inpatients are within the month we chosen and those inpatients should have been received or under receiving the relevant treatment including surgical treatment, chemotherapy and radiotherapy.

overall_official.affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

clinical_study.keyword: Breast cancer, hospital, epidemiology, diagnosis, treatment
